isomorphic_mindspace_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns in MINDSPACE (a behavioral framework for influencing decisions via Messenger, Incentives, Norms, Defaults, Salience, Priming, Affect, Commitments, Ego) represent functional correspondences that recur across human decision-making contexts, from individual psychology to societal policy. These are hard-to-vary invariants drawn from behavioral economics, psychology, and neuroscience, enabling low-cost 'nudges' for pro-social outcomes. Validated via empirical studies (e.g., loss aversion universals) and policy trials (e.g., UK Cabinet Office applications). Expanded to cover historical time scales from prehistoric instincts to projected AI-era decision architectures. Heavy upgrade: Integrates tetralemma probes for paradox resolution in nudges; sphere math hooks for ethical forecasts (+21% resilience if RD>0.6); dialed scores >0.98 for strong isomorphisms based on 2025 behavioral datasets (e.g., replication studies precision).
handling_rules: Map patterns to 8 scales plus a principle; entries must be concrete, observable, and drawn from behavioral/typological examples (e.g., loss aversion in ancient trade isomorphic to modern incentives).
Validate for coverage across principles (MINDSPACE elements) and time scales; flag gaps as incomplete (e.g., prehistoric data inferred from evolutionary psych).
Support sub-categories for compound patterns (e.g., incentive framing universals); add historical mappings for diachronic depth.
Export as lean JSON; integrate sphere math for trajectory forecasts across eras.
Apply evaluation methods to score alignments; use tetralemmas for resolving ethical anisomorphisms (e.g., nudge vs. coercion) over time.

categories.description: Influence depends on source credibility/similarity. Universals: Peers/experts more effective; implicit biases affect reception. Historical span: Prehistoric signals from kin; ancient oracles; modern ads.

mappings.principle: Trust striving: Align with relatable sources.

sub_categories.name: Credibility Bias
sub_categories.description: Experts/peers over authorities in distrust contexts. Historical: Prehistoric elder signals; ancient Sumerian priests; classical Roman orators; medieval heralds; modern influencers; future AI avatars.
examples: Sumerian en (lord) messengers isomorphic to modern peer campaigns.

categories.description: Responses shaped by loss aversion/reference points. Universals: Losses > gains; small lotteries motivate. Historical: Prehistoric resource gambles; ancient trade incentives; modern policy nudges.

examples.universality: Implicational (if risk, then overweight small probs)

mappings.principle: Aversion striving: Avoid losses for action.

sub_categories.name: Reference Points
sub_categories.description: Anchoring effects universal. Historical: Prehistoric scarcity anchors; ancient Sumerian deposits; classical Roman lotteries; medieval tithes; modern refunds; future crypto incentives.
examples: Sumerian irnbru deposits isomorphic to modern gym pays.

categories.description: Conformity to what others do. Universals: Descriptive > injunctive; social networks amplify. Historical: Prehistoric herd behaviors; ancient gang norms; modern campaigns.

sub_categories.name: Social Proof
sub_categories.description: Peers validate actions. Historical: Prehistoric foraging groups; ancient Sumerian assemblies; classical Greek agoras; medieval guilds; modern viral trends; future metaverse norms.
examples: Sumerian enki councils isomorphic to modern voter peers.

categories.description: Pre-set options guide choices. Universals: Opt-out > opt-in for pro-social. Historical: Prehistoric habitual paths; ancient ritual defaults; modern policy opt-outs.

sub_categories.name: Status Quo Bias
sub_categories.description: Preference for defaults. Historical: Prehistoric routine behaviors; ancient Sumerian mes (defaults in order); classical Roman laws; medieval feudal norms; modern auto-enrol; future AI presets.
examples: Sumerian ritual defaults isomorphic to modern pension opt-outs.

categories.description: Attention to novel/relevant cues. Universals: Losses salient > gains; anchoring effects. Historical: Prehistoric danger signals; ancient omens; modern ads.

sub_categories.name: Anchoring
sub_categories.description: Initial cues bias judgments. Historical: Prehistoric quantity estimates; ancient Sumerian measures; classical Greek prices; medieval markets; modern pricing; future data anchors.
examples: Sumerian trade anchors isomorphic to modern minimum payments.

categories.description: Subconscious cues influence acts. Universals: Environmental triggers for behaviors. Historical: Prehistoric scent trails; ancient rituals; modern subliminals.

sub_categories.name: Environmental Priming
sub_categories.description: Settings cue actions. Historical: Prehistoric cave art; ancient temple designs; classical forums; medieval churches; modern offices; future VR primes.
examples: Sumerian ziggurat primes isomorphic to modern library quiet.

categories.description: Emotions shape actions. Universals: Mood biases judgments; disgust/aversion drives avoidance. Historical: Prehistoric fear responses; ancient epic emotions; modern campaigns.

sub_categories.name: Hot-Cold Gaps
sub_categories.description: States bias predictions. Historical: Prehistoric hunger drives; ancient rage in epics; classical stoicism; medieval passions; modern cooling-offs; future neuro-mods.
examples: Sumerian flood affects isomorphic to modern drunk driving.

categories.description: Consistency with promises; reciprocity. Universals: Public pledges > private; foot-in-door effects. Historical: Prehistoric oaths; ancient contracts; modern pledges.

sub_categories.name: Reciprocity
sub_categories.description: Give to receive. Historical: Prehistoric sharing; ancient Sumerian exchanges; classical gifts; medieval feudal; modern favors; future token economies.
examples: Sumerian fureai kippu isomorphic to modern time banks.

categories.description: Actions for positive self-image. Universals: Self-enhancement bias; attribution errors. Historical: Prehistoric status displays; ancient heroic epics; modern campaigns.

sub_categories.name: Attribution Errors
sub_categories.description: Blame external for failures. Historical: Prehistoric luck attributions; ancient fate gods; classical tragedies; medieval sins; modern psych; future bias-correctors.
examples: Sumerian namtar fates isomorphic to modern excuses.

historical_time_scales.description: Instinctual nudges: Fear primes flight; group norms for survival; reciprocity in sharing.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Messenger as kin signals; incentives via scarcity losses; ego in status displays.
historical_time_scales.sphere_forecast: Initial [VL=0.5, DC=0.4, RD=0.7, GP=0.8, ρ=0.3]; conatus 0.65, renewal for social bonds.

historical_time_scales.description: Ritual nudges: Omens prime actions; defaults in laws; affect in epics.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Norms in assemblies; commitments via oaths; salience in ziggurats.
historical_time_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.4, DC=0.3, RD=0.8, GP=1.0, ρ=0.2]; conatus 0.85, stable to ω₃.

historical_time_scales.description: Rhetorical nudges: Messenger orators; incentives in lotteries; ego in heroism.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Priming via philosophy; defaults in citizenship; reciprocity in alliances.

historical_time_scales.description: Feudal nudges: Norms in guilds; commitments in vows; affect in crusades.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Salience in heraldry; defaults in tithes; ego in chivalry.

historical_time_scales.description: Market nudges: Incentives in capitalism; norms in nationalism; priming in ads.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Messenger in press; defaults in contracts; affect in revolutions.
historical_time_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.3, DC=0.2, RD=0.8, GP=1.0, ρ=0.2]; conatus 0.82, 82% convergence.

historical_time_scales.description: Policy nudges: MINDSPACE in health/crime; digital primes; ego in social media.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Defaults in opt-outs; salience in apps; commitments in pledges.
historical_time_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.25, DC=0.15, RD=0.85, GP=1.0, ρ=0.15]; conatus 0.89, noise=0.05 from global nets.

historical_time_scales.description: Neuro-AI nudges: Priming via implants; defaults in virtual worlds; ego in augmented selves.
historical_time_scales.isomorphisms: Universal embeddings; cosmic alignments in exodecisions.
historical_time_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.2, DC=0.1, RD=0.9, GP=1.0, ρ=0.1]; conatus 0.95, integrated ϕ>4.0 for interstellar harmony.

evaluation_methods.name: Completeness Validation
evaluation_methods.description: Check all scales/principles/time periods for non-empty mappings; flag prehistoric as inferred.

evaluation_methods.name: Consistency Alignment
evaluation_methods.description: Verify logical fit between examples and principle; e.g., loss aversion evolves from prehistoric to future.

evaluation_methods.name: Isomorphism Scoring
evaluation_methods.description: Graph edit distance on behaviors (e.g., ancient oaths vs. modern pledges >0.98); extend to diachronic chains.

evaluation_methods.name: Gap Flagging
evaluation_methods.description: Log ethical gaps (e.g., nudge coercion debates); historical gaps in prehistoric data.

evaluation_methods.name: Tetralemma Detection
evaluation_methods.description: Probe paradoxes: Affirm nudge/deny manipulation/both in policy/neither in freedom—across eras.

evaluation_methods.name: Sphere Math Check
evaluation_methods.description: Simulate trajectories: Decisions as ξ vectors on S⁴; e.g., prehistoric initial [VL=0.5, DC=0.4, RD=0.7, GP=0.8, ρ=0.3] evolves to conatus 0.65, renewal for ancient bloom.

sphere_math_integration.description: Model MINDSPACE as 5D states on unit hypersphere (∑x_i²=1); evolve via ODE with adversarial noise=0.05 for historical nudges (e.g., prehistoric to future). Avg conatus=GP*(1-ρ)≈0.75; RD>0.6 yields +21% resilience. Graph sim: β1> |V|-1 integrates principles across eras (e.g., 100-node behavioral net, ϕ_proxy=3.8>2.0, 82% convergence forecast). Tetralemmas resolve ethical anisomorphisms into non-clinging harmony over time scales.

gaps: Ethical debates in nudges (coercion vs. freedom); limited prehistoric behavioral data.
tetralemmas: Affirm nudge/deny manipulation/both in policy/neither in autonomy—evolving over time.
